Description: Limestone offering-table; inscription round edge and two registers of scenes and texts on upper surface, including the name of the owner, Imhotep and his relatives. Lower register shows Imhotep with sacred sycomore; upper register has Nile gods at the sides, with food offerings and flowers in the centre. Finely worked in sunk relief. Channel at top on projecting triangular section.
Dimensions: Weight: 40.40 kilograms (object with fixed stone base)
Curator's comments: Published: J Baines, Fecundity Figures (Warminster, 1985), 62, fig. 40; N Billing, Nut, the Goddess of Life (Uppsala, 2002), 220-221.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1994 Apr-Aug, Museum of St. Albans, Out of Egypt: Every day life in Ancient Egypt
